{
    "number": 192586,
    "data": "2,3,4,5,7,11,13,19,37,43,73",
    "name": "Monotonic ordering of set S generated by these rules:  if x and y are in S and xy-1 is a prime, then xy-1 is in S, and 2 and 4 are in S.",
    "comment": [
        "See the discussions at A192476 and A192580."
    ],
    "mathematica": [
        "start = {2, 4}; primes = Table[Prime[n], {n, 1, 10000}];",
        "f[x_, y_] := If[MemberQ[primes, x*y - 1], x*y - 1]",
        "b[x_] :=",
        "  Block[{w = x},",
        "   Select[Union[",
        "     Flatten[AppendTo[w,",
        "       Table[f[w[[i]], w[[j]]], {i, 1, Length[w]}, {j, 1, i}]]]], # <",
        "      50000 &]];",
        "t = FixedPoint[b, start]  (* A192586 *)"
    ],
    "xref": [
        "Cf. A192476, A192580, A192587, A192588."
    ],
    "keyword": "nonn,fini,full",
    "offset": "1,1",
    "author": "_Clark Kimberling_, Jul 05 2011",
    "references": 3,
    "revision": 6,
    "time": "2016-07-14T16:10:33-04:00",
    "created": "2011-07-06T13:14:18-04:00"
}
